basics.name: Josh Holloway
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary: I'm an experienced Site Reliability Engineer with a track record of providing solutions for Infrastructure Automation, Provisioning and easy to use, self-service tooling to enable other engineers to be more productive. I've got a passion for distributed systems, and having been exposed to microservices at scale I've got a good understanding of the benefits and complexities that come with them. I enjoy working as part of a team but can work equally well alone.

work.summary: Building and maintaining the Automation and Configuration Management systems responsible for SplunkCloud. Orchestrating the provisioning of AWS infrastructure, debugging issues with Splunk and Linux. Performing upgrades, scaling and maintenance on multi-terrabyte Splunk Clusters. Coaching other members of the team in Automation best practices and DevOps philosophies
highlights: Reduced manual intervention required by other team members when replacing failing infrastructure using AWS Lambda and Cloudwatch Events
Improved reliability of Ansible playbooks by writing deterministic and easy to read Ansible roles

work.summary: Developing and maintaining highly available, distributed systems on top of an in house Golang based microservice platform. Peer reviewing code. Identifying and fixing performance bottlenecks/poorly designed code. Automating infrastructure changes through the use of tools such as Puppet and Terraform. Maintaining existing shared infrastructure (Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Zookeeper) and investigating new technologies (Docker, Consul, Kubernetes)
highlights: Refactored underlying Golang framework; removing inefficent calls to core services, increasing reslience to failure and improving uptime
Replaced Jenkins with CircleCI. - Reducing costs and improving developer efficency
Refactored Puppet repository, removing over 65,000 lines of unnecessary code without any breaking changes
Used Docker to give developers the ability to setup their entire development environment in 1 command

work.summary: Designing and developing an microservice based e-commerce platform using a mixture of technologies including Node.js, Golang, Docker, RabbitMQ and PostgreSQL. Integrating with multiple third party APIs (payment providers, shipping service providers).
highlights: Built a fully automated CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins CI
Automated label printing, increasing efficency and reducing number of incorrectly labeled / shipped orders almost zero

work.summary: Developing and maintaining custom software applications at all levels of the system. Designing and documenting solutions (for distribution both internally and to clients) Maintaining both MySQL and MongoDB databases. Designing database schemas; both normalised and denormalised. Maintaining and supporting legacy applications built in a variety of programming languages, including; PHP, .NET 2.0 and Adobe Flex. Setting up testing environments and performing regression testing and UAT's
highlights: Replaced legacy Adobe Flex based UI with current generation HTML/JavaScript based ones
Spent time on client site in Italy to assist in debugging issues with their platform when receiving responses to API calls. Successfully finding the cause and helping implement fix
Lead research into new class of services using node.js. Prototyped replacement of legacy CDR processor (written in .NET) with node.js based version
